column4: hi guys, I posted this in the forums but let's see if any of you can help me. Whenever I try to burn a data DVD I can never fill it with 4.7 GB but around 3.5. However it is possible with WIndows.
both nautilus burn and graveman can't handle 4.7 Gb
weird
cds are ok
I'm taking about DVDs
maybe that got something to do with the kernel?
I have no clue, it's pretty weird.
you say you asked in the forums?
I asked 10 mins ago so it's normal noone replied yet :D
please point me to the thread so I can watch it, I have a dvd burner, it should be of my concern too :)
I'm on hoary too.
what does it do with nautilus-burn, does it say the media doesn't have enough space?
let me know then. Because I have the same issue now :)
I just tried with a 4.0gb file
thanks, what was the error you got?
don't remember exactly, do you need the exact sentence? It just said that the media didn't have enough space
I was too lazy to write it down too :D
want me to make a screenshot? XD
I uploaded the shot, take a look and tell me if that's the same thing
it's a thumbnail, you have to click it no?
just put it into the post
good then :P let's see if they got an idea as to why
hoary I think
